column1: Kata Robata////I had been to Kata Robata once before for happy hour and found James Beard nominated chef Manabu Horichu's modern Japanese dishes to be fresh-tasting
column3: and appropriately priced. My recent dinner reinforced this impression. Considering I often hear Kata mentioned in the same breath as Uchi
column5: and Kuu as the city's premiere sushi destination
column6: I wasn't entirely shocked when it topped the Houston Chronicle's newly released Top 100 list. The ambiance of the restaurant
column7: which is nestled in a strip mall off Richmond ave
column8: is contemporary but subdued. There will likely be a wait around peak hours
column9: and there isn't too much real estate inside by the entrance or bar to stand.
